dialogues.text: There's an elbow bend just below MARTY'S twisting, graspi fingers- the silver bullet lies here. It's less than half inch out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEREWOLF (foaming) Maaa-aaa-rty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE (sobbing) Don't you hurt him! Don't you hurt my brother! She bites one of the WEREWOLF'S hairy ankles as it passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It roars with pain and kicks her aside. Then it looks bac into the hall. It is grinning. I believe it is thinking t is going to be better than a Thanksgiving dinner you don' have to pay for.

dialogues.speaker: WEREWOLF
dialogues.text: Reeeal slow, Maa-aaarty-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's reaching desperately into the duct and staring at th approaching WEREWOLF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTY'S fingers brush the bullet once... again... seize i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls over on his back and sticks the silver bullet blindly into one chamber of the cylinder and slams the cylinder closed.

dialogues.speaker: WEREWOLF
dialogues.text: Bastard Marty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points the gun and pulls the trigger. There's only a click. An expression of dismay on his face.

dialogues.speaker: WEREWOLF
dialogues.text: Kill you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags himself so he's half propped against the hall wa He pulls the trigger again. Click! Dismay becomes fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's reached the Silver Bullet. It smashes it aside. The Bullet hits the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the gun in both hands now, he pulls the trigger a third time. Click! The WEREWOLF'S shadow falls over him.

dialogues.speaker: WEREWOLF
dialogues.text: Bastard Marty! It bends down, reaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craning back as if to drive himself into the wall, he pul the trigger again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet flies from the barrel, gleaming silver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silver bullet strikes him in his one remaining eye. H flies backward, hands clapped to his gushing face... and crashes into MARTY'S Silver Bullet wheelchair. It sits there, roaring... and then it begins to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies there, sobbing. UNCLE AL (voice) You okay, Janey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE AL is bloody and staggering but on his feet. He hel JANE up.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I'm all right... but Marty! Ma- SOUND: SHATTERING ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its hands drop from its face. It is now blind in both eye it is half WEREWOLF and half LOWE. It BELLOWS again, convulses... and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTY (calls) I'm all right. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a creature that is mostly FATHER LOWE collapsed in the remains of MARTY'S wheelchair; beyond it, MARTY is ly on the floor. UNCLE AL goes by the corpse. JANE starts by and LOWE sits bolt upright for a moment, grasping blindly her. She shrieks and darts aside. LOWE falls back, now really dead. I think. Until the sequel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE AL puts a comforting arm around JANE, who is sobbin again- hell, I'd be sobbing after that last one, myself- draws her down beside himself and MARTY. UNCLE AL (to MARTY) There. I told you there weren't any such things as werewolves. They smile at each other with love. JANE (nervous) Are you sure it's dead? Or him? Or whatever it is?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE AL
dialogues.text: If it isn't now, it will be after I pound one of your mother's silver candlesticks through its heart. JANE (grimaces) Oh Uncle Al, no! UNCLE AL (grim) Oh yes, Janey. When I believe something, I believe it all the way. He gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Marty?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: All except my legs... I don't think I can walk.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You're a real booger, you know it? MARTY (smiles) I love you, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TARKER'S MILLS, LONG NIGHT
dialogues.text: Quiet. Sleeping. JANE (voice-over) It wasn't always easy for me to answer that... but I could answer it that night, and I find I can say it now that the terrible events of that fall have receded to memories which seem little more than dreams in my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE (hugging him) I love you, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE (voice-over; no more than a whisper) I love you, Marty... good night. THE CAMERA PANS UP to the full moon.
